name: TradFi Integration
description: Comprehensive evaluation template for traditional finance integration and bridging solutions in Web3
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: Institutional Integration
categories.description: Evaluation of institutional integration capabilities and compliance frameworks

metrics.name: Compliance Framework
metrics.description: Robustness of compliance framework for institutional requirements

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive compliance system with automated KYC/AML, sanctions screening, transaction monitoring; jurisdiction-specific rule enforcement; audit trails for all activities; integration with major compliance vendors; attestation from recognized authorities
thresholds.T1: Basic compliance framework with standard KYC/AML processes; manual monitoring of high-risk transactions; essential record-keeping; some regulatory recognition

metrics.name: Reporting Systems
metrics.description: Quality and comprehensiveness of financial reporting systems for institutions

thresholds.T0: Real-time reporting with customizable dashboards; automated generation of regulatory reports (FINRA, SEC, etc.); tax reporting integration; reconciliation with traditional accounting systems; data exportable in multiple formats
thresholds.T1: Basic periodic reporting; manual export of transaction data; standard financial statements; minimal integration with accounting systems

metrics.name: Audit Systems
metrics.description: Completeness and transparency of audit systems for institutional requirements

thresholds.T0: Immutable audit logs for all activities; cryptographic proof of transaction history; third-party validator access; automated anomaly detection; SOC 2 Type II certification or equivalent; support for big four auditor requirements
thresholds.T1: Basic transaction logging; verifiable history of major activities; manual audit processes; some external validator support

metrics.name: Institutional Custody
metrics.description: Quality of custody solutions for institutional asset management

thresholds.T0: Multi-signature and/or MPC wallet infrastructure; hardware security module integration; insurance coverage; segregated accounts; cold storage options with governance controls; key recovery mechanisms; 24/7 monitoring
thresholds.T1: Basic secure custody with multi-signature support; some insurance coverage; standardized key management protocols; regular security audits

categories.name: Market Bridging
categories.description: Evaluation of traditional and crypto market bridging technologies and mechanisms

metrics.name: Price Oracle Integration
metrics.description: Quality of price oracle implementation for cross-market price discovery

thresholds.T0: Integration with multiple institutional-grade price feeds (Bloomberg, Reuters, etc.); decentralized oracle redundancy; outlier detection; manipulative resistance; sub-second price updates; 99.9%+ uptime; historical price archive
thresholds.T1: Integration with at least one reliable price feed; basic oracle implementation; reasonable price update frequency; anomaly detection mechanisms

metrics.name: Liquidity Bridges
metrics.description: Effectiveness of liquidity bridges between traditional and crypto markets

thresholds.T0: Seamless liquidity routing across traditional and crypto venues; integration with tier 1 banks; multiple fiat on/off ramps; automated liquidity management; deep reserve pools; cross-chain bridging; <15 min settlement
thresholds.T1: Basic liquidity connections with some banking partners; standard fiat on/off ramp capabilities; manual liquidity management; single-chain focus; reasonable settlement times

metrics.name: Settlement Systems
metrics.description: Efficiency and reliability of cross-market settlement systems

thresholds.T0: Atomic settlement or escrow-based guarantees; integration with traditional clearing houses; DVP (delivery versus payment) mechanisms; automated reconciliation; T+0 settlement capabilities; settlement finality guarantees
thresholds.T1: Basic settlement mechanisms with reasonable security; manual reconciliation processes; standard settlement timeframes; clear settlement documentation

metrics.name: Market Data Integration
metrics.description: Comprehensiveness of market data integration across traditional and crypto markets

thresholds.T0: Consolidated data feeds combining traditional market data (equities, bonds, forex) with crypto markets; real-time correlation analysis; comprehensive historical data archive; advanced visualization tools; API access for algorithmic strategies
thresholds.T1: Basic market data from major markets; some cross-market data analysis capabilities; essential historical data; standard visualization options

categories.name: Risk Management
categories.description: Evaluation of risk management systems for cross-market operations

metrics.name: Counterparty Risk Protection
metrics.description: Quality of counterparty protection mechanisms across traditional and crypto markets

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive counterparty risk scoring system; real-time monitoring of exposure limits; automated risk mitigation actions; escrow mechanisms; credit risk modeling; insurance backstops; stress testing framework
thresholds.T1: Basic counterparty risk assessment; manual exposure monitoring; standard risk mitigation protocols; some insurance coverage

metrics.name: Market Risk Controls
metrics.description: Effectiveness of market risk controls for cross-market positions

thresholds.T0: Real-time risk monitoring across all markets; VaR (Value at Risk) calculations; stress testing under extreme scenarios; automated circuit breakers; position limits enforcement; correlation risk monitoring; scenario analysis tools
thresholds.T1: Basic risk monitoring capabilities; standard position limits; manual circuit breakers; essential risk metrics tracking

metrics.name: Cross-Border Regulatory Compliance
metrics.description: Completeness of regulatory compliance across multiple jurisdictions

thresholds.T0: Multi-jurisdictional compliance framework covering US, EU, UK, Singapore, etc.; automated regulatory updates; jurisdiction-specific reporting; legal opinions for major markets; proactive regulatory engagement
thresholds.T1: Compliance with regulations in primary operating jurisdictions; manual regulatory updates; basic cross-border consideration; standard legal documentation

metrics.name: Operational Resilience
metrics.description: Robustness of operational infrastructure across traditional and crypto systems

thresholds.T0: 99.99%+ uptime; geographically distributed redundant systems; real-time failover capabilities; comprehensive BCP/DR plans; regular simulation testing; independent security audits; incident response team
thresholds.T1: Reasonable uptime (>99.5%); basic redundancy systems; documented recovery procedures; periodic security reviews; designated incident handlers

categories.name: Integration Tools
categories.description: Evaluation of integration tools, APIs and developer resources

metrics.name: API Design & Documentation
metrics.description: Quality of API design and documentation for institutional integration

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive REST and GraphQL APIs; financial industry standard endpoints (FIX protocol support); websocket for real-time data; extensive SDKs for multiple languages; detailed documentation with examples; sandbox environment
thresholds.T1: Basic REST API coverage; adequate documentation; support for at least two programming languages; testing environment available

metrics.name: Data Consistency
metrics.description: Quality of data consistency mechanisms between traditional and blockchain systems

thresholds.T0: Atomic consistency guarantees; cryptographic proof of data integrity; real-time reconciliation systems; comprehensive audit trails; data versioning; ACID transaction properties where applicable
thresholds.T1: Basic data consistency checks; periodic reconciliation processes; transaction logs; reasonable data integrity measures

metrics.name: Integration Flexibility
metrics.description: Flexibility of integration options for varied institutional needs

thresholds.T0: Multiple integration pathways (API, SDK, white-label, embedded); customization options for UI/UX; brand white-labeling capabilities; role-based access control; enterprise SSO support; modular feature selection
thresholds.T1: Standard API integration path; some customization options; basic access control; reasonable adaptation to institutional requirements

metrics.name: Enterprise Support & SLAs
metrics.description: Quality of enterprise support and service level agreements

thresholds.T0: 24/7 dedicated support with <1 hour response time; comprehensive SLAs with financial penalties; dedicated account managers; on-site implementation support options; regular system health reports
thresholds.T1: Business hours support with reasonable response times; basic SLAs; designated support contacts; implementation documentation and assistance
